intro: Cryptantha sericea var. perennis, commonly known as the silky cryptantha, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its hairy, blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and thrives in full sun. Its leaves are narrow and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its silvery appearance. It is often found in chaparral and grassland habitats, where it plays a role in stabilizing soil and supporting local pollinators.
